## Overview

The default naming convention of output files is `'$id.$key.$arg.$ext'`,
where:

-   `$id` is the first element of the event tuple.
-   `$key` is the name of the component (e.g. `remove_comments`). This
    can be overridden using `.run(key: "foo")`.
-   `$arg` is the name of the output argument (e.g. `output`).
-   `$ext` is an extension extracted from the `example` or `default` of
    the argument, if it exists.

You can manually specify the output file names by adding it as an
argument.

Example:

``` groovy
  // Concatenate TSVs into one
  //   (String, {input: List[File]}) -> (String, File)
  | combine_columns.run(
    args: [ output: "output.tsv" ]
  )
```

You can use a `map` to ensure that the output name does make use of the
id:

``` groovy
  // Remove comments from TSV
  //   (String, File) -> (String, File)
  | remove_comments.run(
    map: { tup -> [ tup[0], [ input: tup[1], output: "output_${tup[0]}.tsv" ] ] }
  )
```
